com.abdulrhmanil.wallhavenwallpapers.fragments.adapters

Class ThumbPhotosAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<ThumbPhotosAdapter.ThumbPhotoViewHolder>
      • com.abdulrhmanil.wallhavenwallpapers.fragments.adapters.ThumbPhotosAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InlineDownloader.OnFinishDownloadingListener

    public class ThumbPhotosAdapter
extends android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<ThumbPhotosAdapter.ThumbPhotoViewHolder>
implements InlineDownloader.OnFinishDownloadingListener
    Recycler View Adapter that adapt our data (image, resolution...) into the the RecyclerView. So we can show them to the user. This adapter is for the Thumb Photos objects....

      • onCreateViewHolder

        public ThumbPhotosAdapter.ThumbPhotoViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(android.view.ViewGroup parent,
                                                                  int viewType)
        Description copied from class: android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
        Called when RecyclerView needs a new RecyclerView.ViewHolder of the given type to represent an item.

        This new ViewHolder should be constructed with a new View that can represent the items of the given type. You can either create a new View manually or inflate it from an XML layout file.

        The new ViewHolder will be used to display items of the adapter using #onBindViewHolder(ViewHolder, int, List). Since it will be re-used to display different items in the data set, it is a good idea to cache references to sub views of the View to avoid unnecessary View.findViewById(int) calls.

        Specified by:
        onCreateViewHolder in class android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<ThumbPhotosAdapter.ThumbPhotoViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        parent - The ViewGroup into which the new View will be added after it is bound to an adapter position.
        viewType - The view type of the new View.
        Returns:
        A new ViewHolder that holds a View of the given view type.
        See Also:
        RecyclerView.Adapter.getItemViewType(int), #onBindViewHolder(ViewHolder, int)

      • onBindViewHolder

        public void onBindViewHolder(ThumbPhotosAdapter.ThumbPhotoViewHolder holder,
                             int position)
        Description copied from class: android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter
        Called by RecyclerView to display the data at the specified position. This method should update the contents of the RecyclerView.ViewHolder.itemView to reflect the item at the given position.

        Note that unlike ListView, RecyclerView will not call this method again if the position of the item changes in the data set unless the item itself is invalidated or the new position cannot be determined. For this reason, you should only use the position parameter while acquiring the related data item inside this method and should not keep a copy of it. If you need the position of an item later on (e.g. in a click listener), use RecyclerView.ViewHolder.getAdapterPosition() which will have the updated adapter position. Override #onBindViewHolder(ViewHolder, int, List) instead if Adapter can handle efficient partial bind.

        Specified by:
        onBindViewHolder in class android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<ThumbPhotosAdapter.ThumbPhotoViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        holder - The ViewHolder which should be updated to represent the contents of the item at the given position in the data set.
        position - The position of the item within the adapter's data set.

      • updateDownloadButtonIcon

        private void updateDownloadButtonIcon(ThumbPhotosAdapter.ThumbPhotoViewHolder holder,
                                      ThumbPhoto thumbPhoto)
        Update the icon of the download button, while recycle the list, animate the button if download the photo right now.
        Parameters:
        holder - is the view holder, that hold the button, so you can update the button.
        thumbPhoto - is the thumb photo object that contain photo Id.

      • downloadPhotoInline

        private void downloadPhotoInline(ThumbPhotosAdapter.ThumbPhotoViewHolder holder,
                                 ThumbPhoto thumbPhoto,
                                 int position)
        Apply inline downloading for the current photo in the recycler view.
        Parameters:
        holder - is the view holder, so you can update the download button icon.
        thumbPhoto - is the ThumbPhoto object that hold the photo details.
        position - is the index of the photo in the list, recycler view. so we can update and refresh the button icon, after the process is done or fail.

      • isDownloaded

        private boolean isDownloaded(java.lang.String photoId)
        Check if the photo with photoId has been downloaded before, and exist in the local photos, return True if the photo is saved in the default downloads folder, False otherwise.
        Parameters:
        photoId - is the name (unique id) of the photo you want to check if have been downloaded.
        Returns:
        True if the photo has been downloaded and saved in the the downloads folder, False otherwise.

      • isDownloadingNow

        private boolean isDownloadingNow(java.lang.String photoId)
        Return True if the photo with photoId is downloading saving right now, in other words receive the photoId as a parameter and check if this photo is downloading now.
        Parameters:
        photoId - is the Id of the photo you want to check is in the downloading/saving process.
        Returns:
        True if the photo that her Id is equal to photoId is downloading now, False otherwise.

      • isOnline

        private boolean isOnline()
        Return True if there are internet connection or we are connecting now, False otherwise. In other words check if there are internet connection.
        Returns:
        true if connected to internet, false otherwise.

      • showAlertDialog

        private void showAlertDialog()
        Method that show alter dialog on the UI, that there NO internet connection to notify the user.
